Each of these honorary degrees recognise outstanding contributions and achievements to ourâ€¦
data.text: We're delighted to announce ten new honorary Warwick graduates ðŸŽ“ Each of these honorary degrees recognise outstanding contributions and achievements to our community, society, and world. ðŸ’œ Dr Andrew Coe is a paediatrician who has worked at UHCW as a consultant paediatrician and neonatologist since 1990. ðŸ’œ Bience Gawanas is an inspirational champion for women's rights and social justice, committed to improving healthcare and development in Africa. ðŸ’œ Catherine Mallyon has been Executive Director, Governor, and board member of the Royal Shakespeare Company since 2012. ðŸ’œ Sir David Baulcombe is an internationally-acclaimed geneticist and pioneer in the field of plant molecular biology. ðŸ’œ Prof Dudley Shallcross is a chemist who has made many contributions to atmospheric chemistry including climate change, air pollution and stratospheric ozone depletion, leading to awards from the Royal Meteorological Society and the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratories in the USA. ðŸ’œ Dr Heather Melville OBE is a diversity and inclusion leader, celebrated for her tireless efforts to promote equality in the corporate world and empower underrepresented communities. ðŸ’œ Nigel Moss has worked throughout his career both as a teacher and a pastoral care manager for young people with behavioural and learning difficulties. ðŸ’œ Rikki Beadle-Blair MBE is an acclaimed playwright, director, and LGBTQ+ rights advocate, recognised for his ground-breaking contributions to the arts and activism. ðŸ’œ Prof Ruth Wodak is an eminent linguist and sociologist, recognised for her influential research on discourse analysis and the study of language in society. ðŸ’œ Prof Stanley Whittingham is a Nobel Prize-winning researcher in the field of energy storage, renowned for his pivotal contributions to the development of lithium-ion rechargeable batteries. Learn more about our honorary graduates: https://bit.ly/3KkQJzD
